meanings.sent1: She spoke in the mildest tone possible to avoid upsetting anyone.
meanings.sent2: The mildest puppy in the litter was always the first to cuddle with strangers.
meanings.sent3: Even the mildest scolding from her mother made Sarah giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His mildest smile could light up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The mildest breeze carried the scent of blooming flowers into the garden.

meanings.sent1: The mildest punishment for breaking the rule was a warning.
meanings.sent2: Even the mildest criticism from her boss would make her rethink her decisions.
meanings.sent3: The mildest winter in years still brought a blanket of snow to the town.
meanings.sent4: Her mildest glare was enough to make him apologize profusely.
meanings.sent5: The mildest sunburn left her skin pink and tender to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The mildest breeze could easily blow out the candle.
meanings.sent2: His mildest attempt at lifting the heavy box barely made it budge.
meanings.sent3: The mildest coffee in the cafe was too weak even for the regulars.
meanings.sent4: Her mildest punch was like a gentle tap on his shoulder.
meanings.sent5: The mildest stream trickled down the hill, barely making a sound.
